page.title: 15A SCHOOLTEACHER'S DAY (CONT)
page.content: Aircraft at some tremendous speed twist, turn, interweave with each other and dive through the sky. They pass within inches of each other, then head high and fast into the distance. You turn, and an aeroplane sweeps low across the school, while the children scream with a mixture of fear and delight. They race from one end of the playground to the other in excitement. The aircraft team stages a mock attack on the airfield. It may just as well have been on the playground, we are so near. For 20 minutes the sky is filled with movement and artistry, then all is quiet. The afternoon seemed quite an anti-climax, it brought us all literally down to earth. School closes at 3.30. I make a mental note to try to be out of school and across the main road before 4.30 when the crowds from British Aerospace disperse.
